newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil mulls selling Unibanco's ADRs.
newsitem.headline: Brazil mulls selling Unibanco's ADRs.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank said it plans to offer American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) this year backed by the shares of private bank Unibanco it has in its portfolio.
The shares, worth about $1 billion, were given by Unibanco as part payment for the purchase of the healthy portion of failed Banco Nacional.
In November 1995, Unibanco took over selected assets and liabilities of Nacional, which was among Brazil's top 10 financial institutions, after the Central Bank intervened.

What was left of Banco Nacional remained with the Central Bank and has been under process of liquidation. According to Central Bank officials, the offer of ADRs depends on approval by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
